intro: Bigamea hamata, commonly known as the rough-hairy bigamea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are small and typically arranged in clusters, with white or pale yellow petals. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
